cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi (175 km) SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to slow and arc northwest, moving across Cuba Monday, the Florida Straits/Keys Tuesday, then turning north-north-east toward the Florida Gulf Coast and across Georgia/South Carolina mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the north-central Florida Gulf Coast, with the center then crossing inland over southeast Georgia close to Savannah

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast northward through the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind gusts possible (19% chance of ≥34 kt, 4% chance ≥50 kt) late Tuesday night through Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge 1–3 ft possible if the center passes just offshore, but current guidance keeps surge below 3 ft threshold
weather_observation.rainfall: Squalls may produce 2–4 in of rain with isolated higher totals, creating localized flooding around port facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes within outer rain-bands and hazardous seas/strong rip currents likely to disrupt vessel scheduling and cargo operations
